titleInfo.title: First Registered Students in Junior College

mods.abstract: The first registered students for the Christian Brothers College Junior College pose for a photograph. The Junior College reopened in 1940, only to close in 1943 for World War II. Back row (L-R): George O'Connor, James Werkhoven, Robert Hendricks, James Jennings, Leonard Marozas, Barry Williamson. Middle row (L-R): Ed Belote, Robert Luce, John Pera, Curtis Nelson, Joseph Furlong, Vincent O'Neill. Bottom row (L-R): James Craven, Louis Ford, John Harty, Fred Nelson, Louis Renoult, and Lewis Page The junior college had reopened in 1940, but because of the numbers of students entering the military during World War II, the junior college closed in 1943 for the duration of the war.
